title: Macron says Russian victory in Ukraine means Europe 'would not have security'
summary: The French president spoke in a live interview on national television on Wednesday to outline future support for Ukraine.

title: War in Ukraine: Emmanuel Macron's metamorphosis from dove to hawk
summary: Over two years of the conflict, the French president has gone from not wanting to 'humiliate Russia' to suggesting that troops be sent to Ukraine. During this time, he has been confronted by Putin's warlike, all-out logic.

title: Ella Pamfilova, Putin's devoted chief election official
summary: Ella Pamfilova, who was long an adversary of the Russian president one, is now helping secure re-election, as the head of Russia's electoral commission.

title: Father of teen who carried out 2021 Michigan's deadliest school shooting convicted of involuntary manslaughter
summary: James Crumbley, who bought the gun used by his son to kill 4 students, has joined Jennifer Crumbley as a cause of the killing of four students at Oxford High School in 2021, even without pulling the trigger.

title: US Senate leader Schumer calls for 'new election' in Israel
summary: In a speech, Democrat Chuck Schumer suggested that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu risked making Israel a 'pariah.'

title: How Chinese apps have conquered the planet
summary: TikTok, Temu, and Shein, three of the four most downloaded free apps on Android phones in the US are Chinese, just behind the Facebook-owned WhatsApp.

title: Senegal: Top opposition leader freed from prison ahead of presidential election
summary: Presidential candidates in Senegal kicked off their election campaigns on Saturday, following weeks of violent protests across the African country after the vote was delayed last month, just weeks before it was to take place on February 25.

title: Somalia: Islamist group claims new attack in the country's capital
summary: The beleaguered central government launched a major offensive against the Islamists in August 2022, joining forces with local clan militias. But the offensive has suffered setbacks despite early gains.

title: Camille Cottin, star of 'Call My Agent', to host Cannes Film Festival
summary: The French comedian will host the film festival's opening and closing ceremonies, which will take place from May 14 to 25.

title: Belgian aid worker Olivier Vandecasteele: 'Iran made me a bargaining chip for its shameful haggling'
summary: After 455 days in prison in Tehran, Belgian Olivier Vandecasteele was freed in a prisoner swap. He has since launched Protect Humanitarians, which he hopes will help humanitarian workers under threat.

title: Palestinian President Abbas appoints longtime adviser as PM in the face of calls for reform
summary: Mohammad Mustafa was appointed prime minister on Thursday, less than three weeks after his predecessor resigned.

title: Israel wants to control what little food enters Gaza
summary: Israel bombed a food distribution center belonging to UNRWA, the UN agency for Palestinians, killing one employee and wounding 22 others.

title: Haiti crisis: Kenya's hesitations in leading the UN peacekeeping forces
summary: The resignation of Haitian Prime Minister Ariel Henry has dampened Nairobi's enthusiasm as it prepares to deploy a thousand police officers to the Caribbean island.

title: Haiti's 40 years of political instability
summary: The Caribbean nation, which has been moving toward democracy since the establishment of its Constitution in 1987, now finds itself in a political deadlock, with no elected representatives and under the control of gang leaders.

title: France unveils plan to rebuild Beirut port
summary: A proposal prepared by engineering firms Artelia and Egis calls for investments of between $50 million and $80 million.

title: Mbappé  presence at Olympics 'very difficult,' says France coach Deschamps
summary: Didier Deschamps said Euro 2024 remained the 'priority' for his players.

title: Sciences Po divided over contradictory versions of pro-Palestinian rally
summary: President Emmanuel Macron weighed in on a protest at the Paris university, saying 'unspeakable' remarks were made toward a student from the Union of Jewish Students in France. Students who were present offered different accounts of what happened.

title: Macron promises to add 'consent' to France's rape law
summary: In a video filmed on March 8, the French president is seen telling a women's rights group he is in favor of adding the notion of consent to France's rape law, which currently does not mention it.

title: France's CNews channel grilled by lawmakers over 'right-wing content'
summary: Vincent Bolloré, the owner of what is widely seen as France's equivalent to Fox News, was questioned by lawmakers on Wednesday at the Assemblée Nationale.

title: 'They're all high:' Rats eating seized marijuana invade US police headquarters
summary: New Orleans police superintendent Anne Kirkpatrick declared on Thursday, March 14, that the conditions at her department's aging headquarters are so deplorable that officers work amid heavy mold, cockroaches, and even rats munching on contraband in the evidence locker.

title: Violent Mediterranean episodes multiplying as the temperature rises
summary: The floods that struck southeastern France are the result of meteorological phenomena whose intensity is increasing, notably due to the rise in sea surface temperatures in the Mediterranean.

title: Le Monde and Open AI sign partnership agreement on artificial intelligence
summary: This multi-year agreement, the first between a French media organization and a major AI player, will enable OpenAI to draw on our newspaper's corpus to establish and enhance the reliability of the answers of its ChatGPT tool, in return for a significant source of additional revenue.
